alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Warren (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 3:24PM CDT until August 03 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL ST. CHARLES...NORTH CENTRAL FRANKLIN AND SOUTHEASTERN WARREN COUNTIES... At 323 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Marthasville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Wentzville, Washington, Warrenton, Wright City, Marthasville, Innsbrook, New Melle, Dutzow, Foristell and Holstein. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 199 and 203. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
